title.narrative: 104/004 By 2020, Government partners have increased capacities to monitor the situation of girls and boys and their multidimensional vulnerabilities and risks.

description.narrative: Credible and timely disaggregated data is essential to track progress toward national and global commitments. The Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics (BBS) published internationally comparable data on indicators for children and women. To inform policy dialogues, partnerships and interventions to promote children's rights, child-focused provisional estimates of multi-dimensional poverty and multiple overlapping vulnerabilities were made available. The new generation situation analysis (SitAn) provided evidence highlighting new opportunities and showing inequities in the realization of child rights. There were enormous challenges in collection, analysis disaggregation and dissemination of data. BBS needs to build collaboration for capacity building and sharing of best practices. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
